intro: Kandis perfoliata, commonly known as the leafy perfoliate, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of pinnately lobed leaves that often have a woolly texture. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. Kandis perfoliata is often used in traditional medicine and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage.
